Posts.Content: It probably doesn't help, but I had a phone call on a Thursday morning asking if I could get there in 2hours  to have a PICC line fitted ,and oh by the way your chemo starts on Monday!  So you don't always get much notice.  This was 6 1/2 weeks after surgery. Not a great way to be told! I did have a bit of a meltdown . Nicky x
Posts.Title: Fed up, still waiting

Posts.Content: Anyone else been having clexane injections? I developed blood clots in my leg and lungs after my second FEC in October 2015 and  was told I'd have to have then for 6 months.  Today I was told another 2 months which when I see the consultant.  My poor tummy is in such a state now it's getting hard to find a spot. Nicky x
Posts.Title: Blood clots after chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks Lisa, better to have a jab and no clots! Thanks for reminding me...strange how your brain(well mine any way) manages focus on the wrong things!  Nicky xx
Posts.Title: Blood clots after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Highland Mum.  I had it in my mind that the injections were only ever for 6 months . That has made me feel better, even tho I hope it won't be as long as that!  Nicky x
Posts.Title: Blood clots after chemo

Posts.Content: They are great aren't they? I found everything else seemed to press on the scar where the lymph nodes were removed. Not found anything else which is as comfortable...could do with a bit more support 34F do seem to stretch the tops a bit
